intro: Aulomyrcia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, large, and brightly colored flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. Its leaves are typically large, palmately lobed, and have a rough texture. Aulomyrcia grandiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
